biolockj.module.hello_world

Class Step4

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.hello_world.Step1
          • biolockj.module.hello_world.Step2
            • biolockj.module.hello_world.Step3
              • biolockj.module.hello_world.Step4
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApiModule, BioModule, ScriptModule, Comparable<BioModule>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Step5

    public abstract class Step4
extends Step3
    Specify the acceptable input data type for this module. Currently, the way to specify this is through the isValidInputModule method. Test a given module to see if it is an acceptable source of intput data. Your description / details should describe what type of output it makes. Many modules are connected to some other module. They jointly perform a single task, but it still makes sense to break that task into multiple modules. They will reference each as pre- or post-requisite modules.
    Author:
    Ivory Blakley

      • isValidInputModule

        public boolean isValidInputModule(BioModule module)
        Description copied from class: BioModuleImpl
        In the early stages of the pipeline, starting with the very 1st module ImportMetadata, most modules expect sequence files as input. This method returns false if the previousModule only produced a new metadata file, such as ImportMetadata or RegisterNumReads. When BioModuleImpl.getInputFiles() is called, this method determines if the previousModule output is valid input for the current BioModule. The default implementation of this method returns FALSE if the previousModule only generates a new metadata file.
        Specified by:
        isValidInputModule in interface BioModule
        Overrides:
        isValidInputModule in class BioModuleImpl
        Parameters:
        module - BioModule that ran before the current BioModule
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if the previousModule output is acceptable input for the current BioModule
